--- In rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com, Paul Sandoz <Paul.Sandoz@...> 
wrote:
=
> >     PUT /foo.rdf HTTP/1.1
> >     Content-Language: *
> >
> 
> AFAICT '=
*' is not a valid value for a language tag.
> 
>  From the 'owners manual' =
section 3.10 Language Tags [1]:
> 
>          language-tag  =3D primary-tag=
 *( "-" subtag )
>          primary-tag   =3D 1*8ALPHA
>          subtag   =
     =3D 1*8ALPHA
> 
> Paul.
> 
> [1] http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/r=
fc2616-sec3.html#sec3.10
> 

I know that * is permitted in Accept-Language,=
 so I assume that is it 
acceptable in Content-Language too. If not, then I=
 think that the 
absence of a Content-Language header would be equivalent.
=

FYI: I am collating my language negotiation links on del.icio.us at 
http:=
//del.icio.us/alan.dean/accept-language 

Alan

(sorry to Paul for the acci=
dental direct response.)
